p: Cushing's disease (CD) is a common canine endocrinopathy, due to a deregulated secretion of ACTH by a pituitary microadenoma or macroadenoma. A recent study focusing on histopathologic findings in canine pituitary gland identified an overrepresentation of brachycephalic dogs (BD) among macroadenomas, disregarding their secretory status.
